titles.title: Halting HCFA Act of 1999
To impose a one-year moratorium on promulgation of new rules by the Health Care Financing Administration.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committee on Commerce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

term.name: Department of Health and Human Services

bill.summary: 8/3/1999--Introduced. Halting HCFA Act of 1999 - Prohibits the Administrator of the Health Care Financing Administration (HCFA) from promulgating any rules or regulations that impose new requirements under the Social Security Act during the year after the enactment of this Act unless the Secretary of Health and Human Services finds that they are needed to preserve individual health and safety.
